content.question: Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. Identify one and only one of the things by which Aeneas swears in lines 1-2 (Per . . . ima est). 2. According to Greco-Roman mythology, which god ruled tellure sub ima (line 2)? 3. According to line 3 (invitus . . . cessi), how did Aeneas leave the shore? 4. Write out all of line 5 (per loca . . . profundam) and mark the scansion. 5. What is the subject of egere (line 6)? Write your answer in Latin. 6. (A) Translate in context discessu (line 7) and (B) identify its case. 7. To whom is Aeneas’ speech addressed?

frqParts.text: Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. Identify one and only one of the things by which Aeneas swears in lines 1-2 (Per . . . ima est). 2. According to Greco-Roman mythology, which god ruled tellure sub ima (line 2)? 3. According to line 3 (invitus . . . cessi), how did Aeneas leave the shore? 4. Write out all of line 5 (per loca . . . profundam) and mark the scansion. 5. What is the subject of egere (line 6)? Write your answer in Latin. 6. (A) Translate in context discessu (line 7) and (B) identify its case. 7. To whom is Aeneas’ speech addressed?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
